Detailed Description

The Reset Manager (RM) is a component of Power Management (PM) software which helps in putting a particular reset domain or the whole system in reset and bringing the same out of reset by checking if reset has occurred.

The RM is an independent module which is used for monitoring resets occurring in the System and for issuing Resets to various Reset domains which are part of the system.

  • The RM API would not retain any state which would record which reset domain that it is configuring.
  • Only few of the reset domains are software programmable and rest are hardware controlled.

Function Documentation

int32_t PMHALResetAssert ( pmhalPrcmResetGroupId_t  resId)

This API asserts reset for the given reset domain.

Parameters
resIdUnique ID for a Reset Domain
Returns
errorStatus Status of API call. Can be any of the following,
  • PM_SUCCESS Indicates the operation is success
  • PM_FAIL Indicates the ResetDomain is not enabled (timeout)
  • PM_BADARGS Invalid ResetDomain id
int32_t PMHALResetAssertGlobal ( pmhalPrcmGlobalResetGroupId_t  glbResetId)

This API issues the Global Reset.

Parameters
glbResetIdUnique ID for a Global Reset Domain
Returns
errorStatus Status of API call. Can be any of the following,
  • PM_SUCCESS Indicates the operation is success
  • PM_FAIL Indicates the ResetDomain is not enabled (timeout)
  • PM_BADARGS Invalid ResetDomain id

int32_t PMHALResetGetGlobalStatus ( pmhalPrcmGlobalResetGroupId_t  glbResetId,
uint32_t *  rGlbStatusMask 
)

This API is used to get the Reset status of a Global Reset Source.

Parameters
glbResetIdUnique ID for a Global Reset Domain
rGlbStatusMaskStatus of whether the reset was asserted or not
Returns
errorStatus Status of API call. Can be any of the following,
  • PM_SUCCESS Indicates the operation is success
  • PM_FAIL Indicates the ResetDomain is not enabled (timeout)
  • PM_BADARGS Invalid ResetDomain id

  • PM_SUCCESS Indicates the operation is success
  • PM_FAIL Indicates the ResetDomain is not enabled (timeout)
  • PM_BADARGS Invalid ResetDomain id
int32_t PMHALResetRelease ( pmhalPrcmResetGroupId_t  resId,
uint32_t  timeout 
)

This API releases reset for the given reset domain.

Parameters
resIdUnique ID for a Reset Domain
timeoutRequired timeout for which the API should wait for the reset to be released.
PM_TIMEOUT_NOWAIT - The API does not wait.
PM_TIMEOUT_INFINITE - The API waits till the reset domain is released. If it does not happen the API waits infinitely for the reset domain comes out of reset.
Any other value - The API waits to any one of the events to happen first :
(1)(Success)Reset domain released from reset.
(2)(Failure) The timeout is reached but reset domain is still in reset.
Returns
errorStatus Status of API call. Can be any of the following,
  • PM_SUCCESS Indicates the operation is success
  • PM_FAIL Indicates the ResetDomain is not enabled (timeout)
  • PM_BADARGS Invalid ResetDomain id
